alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Somerset (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Somerset, southwestern Worcester and northern Accomack Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 730 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near University Of Maryland Eastern Shore to near Tylerton. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pocomoke City, Princess Anne, University Of Maryland Eastern Shore, Snow Hill, Lawsonia, Westover, West Pocomoke, Marion Station, Saxis, Horntown, Cokesbury, Goodwill, Greenbackville, Kingston, Temperanceville, Shelltown, Sanford, Longridge, Oak Hall and Mount Vernon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
